TopicTitle: How to get the most use out of Mortimer, Walt, Gus and Linus

Articles.Content: I've been trying to search around to find tips and tricks to making maximum use of the Admin Bldg. but without much success. Is there a way to do it? :confused:

You probably aren't getting much success because it isn't that useful. The truth is, science, rep, and funds are easy to get so there is no need to convert them into anything really. The admin build has one good use, and that's converting all science to funds after you finish the tech tree (once it has no other purpose). Overall, it's one of the most useless complex features in the game.

Usually after I get a good amount of reputation - above 500 - I go to the admin building and pick up the reputation-into-money strategy at the maximum committment level of 25% for a tier 1 admin building. Then I leave it like that for the rest of the game. I rarely reach the point where I need other strategies, like the one Alshain mentioned, because I tend to play with extended tech tree mods.

I concur with Alshain's assessment of the admin building's uselessness.

I have no use at all for most of the strategies there. Except the one that turns cash into science, which is (for me) useless in the [I][U]opposite[/U][/I] direction, causing great streaming cascades of science to fall out of the sky. It was amusing to try once, for about half a career, then I got bored with it and restarted. It's too overpowered, it's a game-ruiner for me. If they had implemented it so that it was multiplicative instead of additive (i.e. "you get N% less cash, and receive N% more science" rather than just converting every N funds into a science point, it might have been useful without being overpowered.

I love the [I][U]idea[/U][/I] of the admin building and strategies... it's just the actual implementation that leaves me flat. I'd complain about it more, except that I don't have a lot of constructive suggestions for alternatives.

Early this career I took the strategy that turns rep to science, but couldn't fund it at a high percentage, so it takes rep every time and almost always provides 0 science.. Edited November 22, 2015 by Aethon

I've played maybe a dozen career games now. I used the Admin Building in playthrough #2, and have never felt the need to click on it again. It could be useful in balancing if your playstyle consistently leaves you with too much or too little money for your tech level, but I guess I adjusted my playstyle to fit the default balance instead. :)
